snippet: Churchill Downs, which owns casinos and racetracks, has become the latest company to make a bold move into mobile game.
abstract: Churchill Downs Incorporated, company behind the Kentucky Derby, says it will pay up to $885 million for Big Fish Games, Seattle-based publisher of mobile games.
lead_paragraph: Churchill Downs, which owns casinos and racetracks, has become the latest company to make a bold move into mobile game.

headline.main: Churchill Downs to Buy Big Fish Games for Up to $885 Million
headline.print_headline: Owner of Derby Plans to Buy Game Firm
